definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: He was lazy, disobedient, and wild.
sentences.chinese: 他好吃懒做，是个不听话的十足野孩子。

sentences.english: May be become a lady, and Wild Child will not be sticking to the regulations.
sentences.chinese: 可就算是变成淑女，野孩子也不会规规矩矩。

sentences.english: You may have been perceived as a wild child by adults and a source of concern by your family.
sentences.chinese: 你可能被大人们视为一个野孩子，和被家人所担心。

sentences.english: Wild Child is extremely rare in the world, only a hundred known cases.
sentences.chinese: 野孩子极其少见，在世界上仅有一百余个已知案例。

sentences.english: He has been tangling with some rough boys.
sentences.chinese: 他和几个野孩子在一起鬼混。

sentences.english: Prince Harry lives up to his reputation as a royal wild child.
sentences.chinese: 哈里王子是皇室有名的野孩子。

definition: (PRC) flow of people from the countryside into the cities/rural migrant without definite prospects/drifter
